intro: Delosperma cloeteae, commonly known as the Cloete's ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant produces vibrant flowers in shades of pink, red, and yellow, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its hardy nature, it is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
